compression.guidance: Set compression levelRange of parameters : CompressionLevel>=0 && CompressionLevel<=4

setActivation.guidance: Set activation for the ntuple of given id

setActivationToAll.guidance: Set activation to all ntuplesUI interactors commands.Sub-directories :Commands :addMenu * Add a menu to menu bar.addButton * Add a button to menu.addIcon * Add a non-checkable icon to the Icon toolbar.system * Send a command to the system.

set.guidance: Set parameters for the 1D profile of given id:nbins; xvalMin; xvalMax; xunit; xfunction; xbinSchemeyvalMin; yvalMax; yunit; yfunction

setActivation.guidance: Set activation for the 1D profile of given id

setAscii.guidance: Print 1D profile of given id on ascii file.Range of parameters : id>=0

setPlotting.guidance: (In)Activate batch plotting of the 1D profile of given id

setPlottingToAll.guidance: (In)Activate batch plotting of all 1D profiles2D profile controlSub-directories :Commands :create * Create 2D profileset * Set parameters for the 2D profile of given id:setX * Set parameters for the 2D profile of given id:setZ * Set parameters for the 2D profile of #id:setTitle * Set title for the 2D profile of given idsetXaxis * Set x-axis title for the 2D profile of given idsetYaxis * Set y-axis title for the 2D profile of given idsetZaxis * Set z-axis title for the 2D profile of given idsetAscii * Print 2D profile of given id on ascii file.setActivation * Set activation for the 2D profile of given idsetActivationToAll * Set activation to all 2D profilessetPlotting * (In)Activate batch plotting of the 2D profile of given idsetPlottingToAll * (In)Activate batch plotting of all 2D profiles

setTitle.guidance: Set title for the 1D profile of given id

setX.guidance: Set parameters for the 1D profile of given id:nxbins; xvalMin; xvalMax; xunit; xfunction; xbinScheme

setXaxis.guidance: Set x-axis title for the 1D profile of given id

setY.guidance: Set parameters for the 1D profile of #id:yvalMin; yvalMax; yunit; yfunction

setYaxis.guidance: Set y-axis title for the 1D profile of given id

set.guidance: Set parameters for the 2D profile of given id:nxbins; xvalMin; xvalMax; xunit; xbinSchemenybins; yvalMin; yvalMax; yunit; ybinSchemezvalMin; zvalMax; zunit; zfunction

setActivation.guidance: Set activation for the 2D profile of given id

setAscii.guidance: Print 2D profile of given id on ascii file.Range of parameters : id>=0

setPlotting.guidance: (In)Activate batch plotting of the 2D profile of given id

setTitle.guidance: Set title for the 2D profile of given id

setX.guidance: Set parameters for the 2D profile of given id:nxbins; xvalMin; xvalMax; xunit; xfunction; xbinScheme

setXaxis.guidance: Set x-axis title for the 2D profile of given id

setYaxis.guidance: Set y-axis title for the 2D profile of given id

setZ.guidance: Set parameters for the 2D profile of #id:zvalMin; zvalMax; zunit; zfunction

setZaxis.guidance: Set z-axis title for the 2D profile of given id

setDimensions.guidance: Set the plotter window size (width and height) in pixels.1D histogram controlSub-directories :Commands :create * Create 1D histogramset * Set parameters for the 1D histogram of given id:setX * Set parameters for the 1D histogram of given id:setTitle * Set title for the 1D histogram of given idsetXaxis * Set x-axis title for the 1D histogram of given idsetYaxis * Set y-axis title for the 1D histogram of given idsetAscii * Print 1D histogram of given id on ascii file.setActivation * Set activation for the 1D histogram of given idsetActivationToAll * Set activation to all 1D histogramssetPlotting * (In)Activate batch plotting of the 1D histogram of given idsetPlottingToAll * (In)Activate batch plotting of all 1D histograms

setLayout.guidance: Set page layout (number of columns and rows per page).Suported layouts:columns = 1 .. 2rows    = 1 .. 3 and  >= columns

setStyle.guidance: Only one plotting style is available in low resolution:inlib_default: PAW style with low resolution fonts

setActivation.guidance: Set activation.When this option is enabled, only the histograms marked as activatedare returned, filled or saved on file.No warning is issued when Get or Fill is called on inactive histogram.

setFileName.guidance: Set name for the histograms & ntuple file

setHistoDirName.guidance: Set name for the histograms directory

setNtupleDirName.guidance: Set name for the ntuple directorylD profile controlSub-directories :Commands :setStyle * Only one plotting style is available in low resolution:setLayout * Set page layout (number of columns and rows per page).setDimensions * Set the plotter window size (width and height) in pixels.

verbose.guidance: Set verbose levelRange of parameters : VerboseLevel>=0 && VerboseLevel<=4

add.guidance: Define a new alias as the sum of two values.Syntax : <new_alias> <value1> <value2><new_alias> may be an already existing alias. If it is the case,aliased value is alternated.

alias.guidance: Set an alias.String can be aliased by this command.The string may contain one or more spaces,the string must be enclosed by double quotes (").To use an alias, enclose the alias name withparenthis "{" and "}".

ignoreInitializationCout.guidance: Omit cout from threads during initialization, as they should be identical to the masther thread.This command takes effect only if cout destination is screen without buffering.This command does not affect to cerr.Material scanner commands.Sub-directories :Commands :scan * Start material scanning.theta * Define theta range.phi * Define phi range.singleMeasure * Measure thickness for one particular direction.singleTo * Measure thicknesss for one direction defined by a unit vector.eyePosition * Define the eye position.regionSensitive * Set region sensitivity.region * Define region name to be scanned.

ignoreThreadsExcept.guidance: Omit cout from threads except the specified one.This command takes effect only if cout destination is screen without buffering.If specified thread ID is greater than the number of threads,no cout is displayed from worker threads. -1 to reset.This command does not affect to cerr.

prefixString.guidance: Set the prefix string for each cout/cerr line from a thread.

setCerrFile.guidance: Send G4cerr stream to a file dedicated to a thread.To have a display output, use special keyword "**Screen**".If append flag is true output is appended to file,otherwise file output is overwritten.

setCoutFile.guidance: Send G4cout stream to a file dedicated to a thread.To have a display output, use special keyword "**Screen**".If append flag is true output is appended to file,otherwise file output is overwritten.

useBuffer.guidance: Send cout and/or cerr stream to a buffer.The buffered text will be printed at the end of the jobfor each thread at a time, so that output of each thread is grouped.This command has no effect if output goes to a file.

createHTML.guidance: Generate HTML files for all of sub-directories and commands.Directory path should be given by FULL-PATH.

divide.guidance: Define a new alias as the division of two values.Syntax : <new_alias> <value1> <value2><new_alias> may be an already existing alias. If it is the case,aliased value is alternated.

doif.guidance: Execute a macro file if the expression is true.Syntax : <double> <comp> <double> <UI_command>

foreach.guidance: Execute a macro file more than once.Loop counter can be used as an aliased variable.Values must be separated by a space.

getEnv.guidance: Get a shell environment variable and define it as an alias.

getVal.guidance: Get the current value of the UI command and define it as an alias.Command is ignored if the UI command does not support GetCurrentValue().Syntax : <alias_name> <UI_command>

if.guidance: Execute a macro file if the expression is true.Syntax : <double> <comp> <double> <macro_file>

loop.guidance: Execute a macro file more than once.Loop counter can be used as an aliased variable.

macroPath.guidance: Set macro search pathwith colon-separated list.

manual.guidance: Display all of sub-directories and commands.Directory path should be given by FULL-PATH.

phi.guidance: Define phi range.Usage : /control/matScan/phi [nbin] [phiMin] [phiSpan] [unit]Notation of angles :phi   --- +X axis : 0 deg. / +Y axis : 90 deg. / -X axis : 180 deg. / -Y axis : 270 deg.

region.guidance: Define region name to be scanned./control/matScan/regionSensitive command is automaticallyset to TRUE with this command.Available units.Sub-directories :Commands :list * full list of available units.

regionSensitive.guidance: Set region sensitivity.This command is automatically set to TRUEif /control/matScan/region command is issued.

scan.guidance: Start material scanning.Scanning range should be defined with/control/matScan/theta and /control/matSca/phi commands.

singleMeasure.guidance: Measure thickness for one particular direction.Notation of angles :theta --- +Z axis : +90 deg. / X-Y plane : 0 deg. / -Z axis : -90 deg.phi   --- +X axis : 0 deg. / +Y axis : 90 deg. / -X axis : 180 deg. / -Y axis : 270 deg.

singleTo.guidance: Measure thicknesss for one direction defined by a unit vector.

theta.guidance: Define theta range.Usage : /control/matScan/theta [nbin] [thetaMin] [thetaSpan] [unit]Notation of angles :theta --- +Z axis : +90 deg. / X-Y plane : 0 deg. / -Z axis : -90 deg.

maximumStoredHistory.guidance: Set maximum number of stored UI commands.

multiply.guidance: Define a new alias as the multiplification of two values.Syntax : <new_alias> <value1> <value2><new_alias> may be an already existing alias. If it is the case,aliased value is alternated.

remainder.guidance: Define a new alias as the remainder of two values.Syntax : <new_alias> <value1> <value2><new_alias> may be an already existing alias. If it is the case,aliased value is alternated.Control cout/cerr for local thread.Sub-directories :Commands :setCoutFile * Send G4cout stream to a file dedicated to a thread.setCerrFile * Send G4cerr stream to a file dedicated to a thread.useBuffer * Send cout and/or cerr stream to a buffer.prefixString * Set the prefix string for each cout/cerr line from a thread.ignoreThreadsExcept * Omit cout from threads except the specified one.ignoreInitializationCout * Omit cout from threads during initialization, as they should be identical to the masther thread.

saveHistory.guidance: Store command history to a file.Defaul file name is G4history.macro.

subtract.guidance: Define a new alias as the subtraction of two values.Syntax : <new_alias> <value1> <value2><new_alias> may be an already existing alias. If it is the case,aliased value is alternated.

suppressAbortion.guidance: Suppress the program abortion caused by G4Exception.Suppression level = 0 : no suppression= 1 : suppress during EventProc state= 2 : full suppression, i.e. no abortion by G4ExceptionWhen abortion is suppressed, you will get error messages issued by G4Exception,and there is NO guarantee for the correct result after the G4Exception error message.Range of parameters : level >= 0 && level <= 2

verbose.guidance: Applied command will also be shown on screen.This command is useful with MACRO file.0 : silent1 : only the valid commands are shown.2 : comment lines are also shown (default).Range of parameters : switch >= 0 && switch <=2

dump.guidance: Dump cuplues in ProductuinCutsTable.Command directory path : /run/Run control commands.Sub-directories :/run/particle/   Commands for G4VUserPhysicsList.Commands :initialize * Initialize G4 kernel.beamOn * Start a Run.verbose * Set the Verbose level of G4RunManager.printProgress * Display begin_of_event information at given frequency.numberOfThreads * Set the number of threads to be used.useMaximumLogicalCores * Set the number of threads to be the number of available logical cores.pinAffinity * Locks each thread to a specific logical core. Workers are locked in round robin to logical cores.eventModulo * Set the event modulo for dispatching events to worker threadsdumpRegion * Dump region information.dumpCouples * Dump material-cuts-couple information.optimizeGeometry * Set the optimization flag for geometry.breakAtBeginOfEvent * Set a break point at the begining of every event.breakAtEndOfEvent * Set a break point at the end of every event.abort * Abort current run processing.abortCurrentEvent * Abort currently processing event.geometryModified * Force geometry to be closed (re-voxellized) again.reinitializeGeometry * Force geometry to be rebuilt once again.physicsModified * Force all physics tables recalculated again.constructScoringWorlds * Constrct scoring parallel world(s) if defined.storeRndmStatToEvent * Flag to store rndm status to G4Event object.setCut * Set default cut valuesetCutForAGivenParticle * Set a cut value to a specific particlegetCutForAGivenParticle * Get a cut value to a specific particlesetCutForRegion * Set cut value for a region

setHighEdge.guidance: Set high edge energy valueRange of parameters : edge >0.0

setLowEdge.guidance: Set low edge energy valueRange of parameters : edge >0.0

setMaxCutEnergy.guidance: Set maximum of cut energy valueRange of parameters : cut >0.0

verbose.guidance: Set the Verbose level of G4ProductionCutsTable.0 : Silent (default)1 : Display warning messages2 : Display more info2 : Display debug infoRange of parameters : level >=0 && level <=3

keepCurrentEvent.guidance: Store the current event to G4Run object instead of deleting it at the end of event.Stored event is available through G4Run until the begining of next run.Given the potential large memory size of G4Event and its datamember objects stored in G4Event,the user must be careful and responsible for not to store too many G4Event objects.Command directory path : /event/stack/Stack control commands.Sub-directories :Commands :status * List current status of the stack.clear * Clear stacked tracks.verbose * Set verbose level for G4StackManager

clear.guidance: Clear stacked tracks.2 : clear all tracks in all stacks1 : clear tracks in the urgent and waiting stacks0 : clear tracks in the waiting stack (default)-1 : clear tracks in the urgent stack-2 : clear tracks in the postponed stackRange of parameters : level>=-2&&level<=2

status.guidance: List current status of the stack.

verbose.guidance: Set verbose level for G4StackManager0 : Silence (default)1 : Minimum statistics2 : Detailed reportsNote - this value is overwritten by /event/verbose command.Commands for G4VUserPhysicsList.Sub-directories :Commands :verbose * Set the Verbose level of G4ProductionCutsTable.setLowEdge * Set low edge energy valuesetHighEdge * Set high edge energy valuesetMaxCutEnergy * Set maximum of cut energy valuedump * Dump cuplues in ProductuinCutsTable.
Set Verbose level of event management category.0 : Silent1 : Stacking information2 : More...Range of parameters : level>=0

check_mode.guidance: Set navigator in -check_mode- state.This will cause extra checks to be applied duringnavigation. More strict and less tolerant conditionsare applied. A run-time performance penalty may beobserved when the -check_mode- state is activated.NOTE: this command has effect -only- if Geant4 hasbeen installed with the G4VERBOSE flag set!

push_notify.guidance: Set navigator verbosity push notifications.This allows to disable/re-enable verbosity innavigation, when tracks may get stuck and requireone artificial push along the direction by thenavigator. Notification is active by default.NOTE: this command has effect -only- if Geant4 hasbeen installed with the G4VERBOSE flag set!Geometry verification control setup.Helps in detecting possible overlapping regions.Sub-directories :Commands :tolerance * Define tolerance (in mm) by which overlaps reportsverbosity * Specify if running in verbosity mode or not.resolution * Set the number of points on surface to be generated forrecursion_start * Set the initial level in the geometry tree for recursion.recursion_depth * Set the depth in the geometry tree for recursion.maximum_errors * Set the maximum number of overlap errors to reportrun * Start running the recursive overlap check.

reset.guidance: Reset navigator and navigation history.NOTE: must be called only after kernel has beeninitialized once through the run manager!

verbose.guidance: Set run-time verbosity for the navigator.0 : Silent (default)1 : Display volume positioning and step lengths2 : Display step/safety info on point location3 : Display minimal state at -every- step4 : Maximum verbosity (very detailed!)NOTE: this command has effect -only- if Geant4 hasbeen installed with the G4VERBOSE flag set!Range of parameters : level >=0 && level <=4

maximum_errors.guidance: Set the maximum number of overlap errors to reportfor each single volume being checked.Once reached the maximum number specified, overlapsaffecting that volume further than that are simply ignored.

recursion_depth.guidance: Set the depth in the geometry tree for recursion.recursive_test will then stop after reached the specified depth.By default, recursion will proceed for the whole depth.

recursion_start.guidance: Set the initial level in the geometry tree for recursion.recursive_test will then start from the specified level.

resolution.guidance: Set the number of points on surface to be generated forchecking overlaps.

run.guidance: Start running the recursive overlap check.Volumes are recursively asked to verify for overlapsfor points generated on the surface against theirrespective mother volume and sisters at the samelevel, performing for all daughters and daughters ofdaughters, etc.NOTE: it may take a very long time,depending on the geometry complexity !Command directory path : /tracking/TrackingManager and SteppingManager control commands.Sub-directories :Commands :abort * Abort current G4Track processing.resume * Resume current G4Track processing.storeTrajectory * Store trajectories or not.verbose * Set Verbose level of tracking category.

tolerance.guidance: Define tolerance (in mm) by which overlaps reportsshould be reported. By default, all overlaps arereported, i.e. tolerance is set to: 0*mm.

verbosity.guidance: Specify if running in verbosity mode or not.By default verbosity is set to ON (TRUE).

addIcon.guidance: Add a non-checkable icon to the Icon toolbar.If the Icon parameter is set to "user_icon", you should provide the icon file in xpm format, otherwise you have to choose one of the candidate iconsA command given without parameters will display a window that will allow one to choose the parameters (if needed) for this command.E.g: /gui/addIcon "Change background color" user_icon /vis/viewer/set/background ../Images/background.xpmSpecial cases for the Icon parameter:- open: Open an open-file-selector that can run the Command with File as argument.- save: Open a save-file-selector that can run the Command with File as argument.- move/rotate/pick/zoom_in/zoom_out: Theses icons are radio-button icons that can change cursor action.- wireframe/solid/hidden_line_removal/hidden_line_and_surface_removal: These icons are radio-button icons that can change drawing style.- perspective/ortho: These icons are radio-button icons that can change projection style.

addMenu.guidance: Add a menu to menu bar.

system.guidance: Send a command to the system.Geometry control commands.Sub-directories :/geometry/navigator/   Geometry navigator control setup./geometry/test/   Geometry verification control setup.Commands :Command directory path : /geometry/navigator/Geometry navigator control setup.Sub-directories :Commands :reset * Reset navigator and navigation history.verbose * Set run-time verbosity for the navigator.check_mode * Set navigator in -check_mode- state.push_notify * Set navigator verbosity push notifications.

direction.guidance: Set momentum direction.Direction needs not to be a unit vector.Range of parameters : ex != 0 || ey != 0 || ez != 0

ion.guidance: Set properties of ion to be generated.[usage] /gun/ion Z A QZ:(int) AtomicNumberA:(int) AtomicMassQ:(int) Charge of Ion (in unit of e)E:(double) Excitation energy (in keV)

ionL.guidance: Set properties of ion to be generated.[usage] /gun/ion Z A Q IZ:(int) AtomicNumberA:(int) AtomicMassQ:(int) Charge of Ion (in unit of e)I:(int) Level number of metastable state (0 = ground)

momentum.guidance: Set momentum. This command is equivalent to two commands /gun/direction and /gun/momentumAmpRange of parameters : px != 0 || py != 0 || pz != 0

momentumAmp.guidance: Set absolute value of momentum.Direction should be set by /gun/direction command.This command should be used alternatively with /gun/energy.

number.guidance: Set number of particles to be generated.Range of parameters : N>0

particle.guidance: Set particle to be generated.(geantino is default)(ion can be specified for shooting ions)

position.guidance: Set starting position of the particle.

time.guidance: Set initial time of the particle.

processAbsLevel.guidance: Set absolute energy level (with unit) of allowed energy non-conservation

processRelLevel.guidance: Set relative level of allowed energy non-conservationParticle Gun control commands.Sub-directories :Commands :List @ List available particles.particle @ Set particle to be generated.direction @ Set momentum direction.energy @ Set kinetic energy.momentum @ Set momentum. This command is equivalent to two commands /gun/direction and /gun/momentumAmpmomentumAmp @ Set absolute value of momentum.position @ Set starting position of the particle.time @ Set initial time of the particle.polarization @ Set polarization.number @ Set number of particles to be generated.ion @ Set properties of ion to be generated.ionL @ Set properties of ion to be generated.

reportLevel.guidance: Set level of detail reported upon E/p non-conservation0 - (default) no reporting1 - report only when E/p not conserved2 - report regardless of E/p conservation3 - report only when E/p not conserved, with names, limits4 - report regardless of E/p conservation, with names, limitsRange of parameters : ReportLevel >= 0 && ReportLevel < 5

verbose.guidance: Set the Verbose level.Controls for the hadronic energy/momentum testSub-directories :Commands :reportLevel * Set level of detail reported upon E/p non-conservationprocessAbsLevel * Set absolute energy level (with unit) of allowed energy non-conservationprocessRelLevel * Set relative level of allowed energy non-conservation

Set verbose level.Commands for the nist dataBaseSub-directories :Commands :printElement * print element(s) in dataBase.printElementZ * print element Z in dataBase.listMaterials * Materials in Geant4 dataBase.

activate.guidance: Activate processActivate [process index]Range of parameters : index >=0

dump.guidance: dump process manager or process informationdump [process index]process index: -1 for process manager

inactivate.guidance: Inactivate processinactivate [process index]Range of parameters : index >=0EventManager control commands.Sub-directories :/event/stack/   Stack control commands.Commands :abort * Abort current event.verbose * Set Verbose level of event management category.keepCurrentEvent * Store the current event to G4Run object instead of deleting it at the end of event.

verbose.guidance: Set Verbose Level for Process or Process ManagerVerbose [Verbose] [process index]process index: -1 for process manager

lifetime.guidance: Set life time.Unit of the time can be :s, ms, ns (default)Range of parameters : life >0.0

stable.guidance: Set stable flag.false: Unstable   true: Stable

verbose.guidance: Set Verbose level of particle property.0 : Silent (default)1 : Display warning messages2 : Display moreRange of parameters : verbose_level >=0Decay Table control commands.Sub-directories :Commands :select * Enter index of decay mode.dump * Dump decay mode information.br * Set branching ratio. [0< BR <1.0]

Set Verbose level of particle table.0 : Silent (default)1 : Display warning messages2 : Display moreRange of parameters : verbose_level >=0Nuclide table control commands.Sub-directories :Commands :min_halflife * Set threshold of half-life.level_tolerance * Set tolerance in level seaching.

MuonNuclear.guidance: Switching on muon nuclear physics.Visualization commands.Sub-directories :/vis/ASCIITree/   Commands for ASCIITree control./vis/heprep/   HepRep commands./vis/rayTracer/   RayTracer commands./vis/gMocren/   gMocren commands./vis/ogl/   G4OpenGLViewer commands./vis/modeling/   Modeling commands./vis/filtering/   Filtering commands./vis/geometry/   Operations on vis attributes of Geant4 geometry./vis/multithreading/   Commands unique to multithreading mode./vis/set/   Set quantities for use in future commands where appropriate./vis/scene/   Operations on Geant4 scenes./vis/sceneHandler/   Operations on Geant4 scene handlers./vis/touchable/   Operations on touchables./vis/viewer/   Operations on Geant4 viewers.Commands :verbose * Simple graded message scheme - digit or string (1st character defines):initialize * Initialise visualisation manager.abortReviewKeptEvents * Abort review of kept events.enable * Enables/disables visualization system.disable * Disables visualization system.list * Lists visualization parameters.reviewKeptEvents * Review kept events.drawTree * (DTREE) Creates a scene consisting of this physical volume and  produces a representation of the geometry hieracrhy.drawView * Draw view from this angle, etc.drawVolume * Creates a scene containing this physical volume and asks thecurrent viewer to draw it.  The scene becomes current.open * Creates a scene handler ready for drawing.specify * Draws logical volume with Boolean components, voxels and readout geometry.

SyncRadiationAll.guidance: Switching on/off synchrotron radiation for all charged.

activate.guidance: Activate processesActivate  name [particle]name:     process name or type nameparticle: particle name [all: for all particles]

dump.guidance: Dump process informationdump name [particle]name:     process name or type nameparticle: particle name [all: for all particles]

LambdaFactor.guidance: Set lambdaFactor parameter for integral option

StepFunction.guidance: Set the energy loss step limitation parameters.dRoverR   : max Range variation per stepfinalRange: range for final step

binsDEDX.guidance: Set number of bins for EM tables

binsLambda.guidance: Set number of bins for EM tables

binsPerDecade.guidance: Set number of bins per decade for EM tables

integral.guidance: Switch true/false the integral optionCommands for EM scattering processes.Sub-directories :Commands :LateralDisplacement * Enable/disable sampling of lateral displacementMuHadLateralDisplacement * Enable/disable sampling of lateral displacement for muons and hadronsDisplacementBeyondSafety * Enable/disable displacement at geometry boundaryUseMottCorrection * Enable usage of Mott corrections for e- elastic scatteringFactorForAngleLimit * Set factor for computation of a limit for -t (invariant trasfer)ThetaLimit * Set the limit on the polar angle for msc and single scatteringRangeFactor * Set RangeFactor for msc processes of e+-RangeFactorMuHad * Set RangeFactor for msc processes of muons/hadronsGeomFactor * Set GeomFactor parameter for msc processesSkin * Set skin parameter for msc processesStepLimit * Set msc step limitation typeStepLimitMuHad * Set msc step limitation type for muons/hadrons

maxKinEnergy.guidance: Set the max kinetic energy for EM tables

maxKinEnergyCSDA.guidance: Set the max kinetic energy for CSDA table

minKinEnergy.guidance: Set the min kinetic energy for EM tables

useCutAsFinalRange.guidance: Enable?disable use of cut in range as a final range

verbose.guidance: Set verbose level for EM physics

AddDNARegion.guidance: Activate DNA in the G4Region.regName   : G4Region namednaType   : opt0, opt1, opt2

AddMicroElecRegion.guidance: Activate MicroElec model in the G4Region

AddPAIRegion.guidance: Activate PAI in the G4Region.partName  : particle name (default - all)regName   : G4Region namepaiType   : PAI, PAIphoton

applyCuts.guidance: Enable/disable applying cuts for gamma processes

augerCascade.guidance: Enable/disable simulation of cascade of Auger electrons

deexcitation.guidance: Set deexcitation flags per G4Region.regName   : G4Region nameflagFluo  : FluorescenceflagAuger : AugerflagPIXE  : PIXE

deexcitationIgnoreCut.guidance: Enable/Disable usage of cuts in de-excitation module

fluoBearden.guidance: Enable/disable usage of Bearden fluorescence files

lowestElectronEnergy.guidance: Set the lowest kinetic energy for e+-

lowestMuHadEnergy.guidance: Set the lowest kinetic energy for muons and hadrons

pixeElecXSmodel.guidance: The name of PIXE cross section for electron

pixeXSmodel.guidance: The name of PIXE cross section

setBiasingFactor.guidance: Set factor for the process cross section.procName   : process nameprocFact   : factorflagFact   : flag to change weight

setForcedInteraction.guidance: Set factor for the process cross section.procNam    : process nameregNam     : region nametlength    : fixed target lengthtflag      : flag to change weight

setSecBiasing.guidance: Set bremsstrahlung or delta-e- splitting/Russian roullette per region.bProcNam : process namebRegNam  : region namebFactor  : number of splitted gamma or probability of Russian roulettebEnergy  : max energy of a secondary for this biasing methodunit of energyanalysis controlSub-directories :/analysis/plot/   lD profile control/analysis/h1/   1D histogram control/analysis/h2/   2D histogram control/analysis/h3/   3D histogram control/analysis/p1/   1D profile control/analysis/p2/   2D profile control/analysis/ntuple/   ...Title not available...Commands :setActivation * Set activation.When this option is enabled, only the histograms marked as activatedare returned, filled or saved on file.No warning is issued when Get or Fill is called on inactive histogram.verbose * Set verbose levelcompression * Set compression levelsetFileName * Set name for the histograms & ntuple filesetHistoDirName * Set name for the histograms directorysetNtupleDirName * Set name for the ntuple directory

spline.guidance: Enable/disable usage spline for Physics Vectors

verbose.guidance: Set verbose level for EM physics

workerVerbose.guidance: Set worker verbose level for EM physics

nuclearRadiusScale.guidance: Set length scale for nuclear model

piNAbsorption.guidance: Probability for pion absorption on single nucleon

randomFile.guidance: Save random-engine to file at each interaction

shadowningRadius.guidance: Effective nucleon radius for trailing effect

showHistory.guidance: Collect and report full structure of cascade

useBestNuclearModel.guidance: Use all physical-units for nuclear structure

verbose.guidance: Enable information messages

do_not_adjust_final_state.guidance: Disable to adjust final state for getting better conservation.

neglect_Doppler_broadening.guidance: Switch off the Doppler broadening due to the thermal motion of the target nucleus.This option provides a significant CPU performance advantage.

skip_missing_isotopes.guidance: Use only exact isotope data files, instead of allowing nearby isotope files to be used.In this case if the exact file is not available, the cross section will be set to zero.

use_photo_evaporation.guidance: Force the use of the Photon Evaporation model, instead of the neutron capture final state data.

verbose.guidance: Set Verbose level of ParticleHP packageRange of parameters : verbose_level >=0Bertini-esque cascade parametersSub-directories :Commands :verbose * Enable information messagescheckBalance * Enable internal conservation checkingreport * Dump all non-default parameter settingsusePreCompound * Use PreCompoundModel for nuclear de-excitationdoCoalescence * Apply final-state nucleon clusteringpiNAbsorption * Probability for pion absorption on single nucleonshowHistory * Collect and report full structure of cascadeuse3BodyMom * Use three-body momentum parametrizationsusePhaseSpace * Use Kopylov N-body momentum generatorrandomFile * Save random-engine to file at each interactionuseBestNuclearModel * Use all physical-units for nuclear structureuseTwoParamNuclearRadius * Use R = C1*cbrt(A) + C2/cbrt(A)nuclearRadiusScale * Set length scale for nuclear modelsmallNucleusRadius * Set radius of A<4 nucleialphaRadiusScale * Fraction of small-radius for He-4shadowningRadius * Effective nucleon radius for trailing effectfermiScale * Scale factor for fermi momentumcrossSectionScale * Scale fator for total cross-sectionsgammaQuasiDeutScale * Scale factor for gamma-quasideutron cross-sectionscluster2DPmax * Maximum momentum for p-n clusterscluster3DPmax * Maximum momentum for ppn/pnn clusterscluster4DPmax * Maximum momentum for alpha clusters

inactivate.guidance: Inactivate processInactivate processesInactivate  name [particle]name:     process name or type nameparticle: particle name [all: for all particles]UI commands of ParticleHPSub-directories :Commands :use_photo_evaporation *  Force the use of the Photon Evaporation model, instead of the neutron capture final state data.skip_missing_isotopes * Use only exact isotope data files, instead of allowing nearby isotope files to be used.neglect_Doppler_broadening * Switch off the Doppler broadening due to the thermal motion of the target nucleus.do_not_adjust_final_state * Disable to adjust final state for getting better conservation.produce_fission_fragment * Enable to generate fission fragments.verbose * Set Verbose level of ParticleHP package

list.guidance: List up process nameslist [type]type: process type [all:for all proceeses]

FactorForAngleLimit.guidance: Set factor for computation of a limit for -t (invariant trasfer)Range of parameters : Fact>0

GeomFactor.guidance: Set GeomFactor parameter for msc processesRange of parameters : Fg>0

MuHadLateralDisplacement.guidance: Enable/disable sampling of lateral displacement for muons and hadrons

RangeFactor.guidance: Set RangeFactor for msc processes of e+-Range of parameters : Fr>0

RangeFactorMuHad.guidance: Set RangeFactor for msc processes of muons/hadronsRange of parameters : Fr>0

Skin.guidance: Set skin parameter for msc processes

StepLimitMuHad.guidance: Set msc step limitation type for muons/hadronsGeneral commands for EM processes.Sub-directories :Commands :spline * Enable/disable usage spline for Physics VectorsapplyCuts * Enable/disable applying cuts for gamma processesfluo * Enable/disable atomic deexcitationfluoBearden * Enable/disable usage of Bearden fluorescence filesauger * Enable/disable Auger electrons productionaugerCascade * Enable/disable simulation of cascade of Auger electronspixe * Enable/disable PIXE simulationdeexcitationIgnoreCut * Enable/Disable usage of cuts in de-excitation modulelowestElectronEnergy * Set the lowest kinetic energy for e+-lowestMuHadEnergy * Set the lowest kinetic energy for muons and hadronsverbose * Set verbose level for EM physicsworkerVerbose * Set worker verbose level for EM physicspixeXSmodel * The name of PIXE cross sectionpixeElecXSmodel * The name of PIXE cross section for electronAddPAIRegion * Activate PAI in the G4Region.AddMicroElecRegion * Activate MicroElec model in the G4RegionAddDNARegion * Activate DNA in the G4Region.printParameters * Print all EM parameters.deexcitation * Set deexcitation flags per G4Region.setBiasingFactor * Set factor for the process cross section.setForcedInteraction * Set factor for the process cross section.setSecBiasing * Set bremsstrahlung or delta-e- splitting/Russian roullette per region.

ThetaLimit.guidance: Set the limit on the polar angle for msc and single scattering

UseMottCorrection.guidance: Enable usage of Mott corrections for e- elastic scattering

setVerbose.guidance: Set verbose level for processessetVerbose level [type or name]level: verbose levelname : process nametype : process type[all] for all proceeses

verbose.guidance: Set Verbose Level for Process Tableverbose [level]level: verbose levelRange of parameters : verbose >=0

resetEngineFrom.guidance: Reset the status of the rndm engine from a file.See CLHEP manual for detail.The engine status must be stored beforehand.Directory of the status file should be set by /random/setDirectoryName.

resetEngineFromEachEvent.guidance: Reset the status of the rndm engine from a file at each event.Note that the file must follow the following naming convention:run{#1}evt{#2}.rndm ; where #1 is the run number and #2 is the event number.For example to re-seed the first event of the first run the file should be called run0evt0.rndm.If for a specific run/event the file is not found, the standard re-seeding strategy is used.This command has meaning only in MT mode for strong reproducibility studies.Directory of the status file should be set by /random/setDirectoryName.

saveEachEventFlag.guidance: Save random number status at beginning of each event.File name contains run and event numbers: runXXXevtYYY.rndmcommands related to the physics simulation engine.Sub-directories :/physics_lists/em/   tailoring the processesCommands :Command directory path : /physics_lists/em/tailoring the processesSub-directories :Commands :SyncRadiation * Switching on/off synchrotron radiation.SyncRadiationAll * Switching on/off synchrotron radiation for all charged.GammaNuclear * Switching on gamma nuclear physics.MuonNuclear * Switching on muon nuclear physics.

setDirectoryName.guidance: Define the directory name of the rndm status files.Directory will be created if it does not exist.

setSavingFlag.guidance: The randomNumberStatus will be saved at :begining of run (currentRun.rndm) and begining of event (currentEvent.rndm)

setSeeds.guidance: Initialize the random number generator with integer seed stream.Number of integers should be more than 1.Actual number of integers to be used depends on the individual random number engine.This command sets the seeds for the master thread.

abort.guidance: Abort current run processing.If softAbort is false (default), currently processing event will be immediately aborted,while softAbort is true, abortion occurs after processing the current event.

beamOn.guidance: Start a Run.If G4 kernel is not initialized, it will be initialized.Default number of events to be processed is 1.The second and third arguments can be used forexecuting a macro file at the end of each event.If the second argument, i.e. name of the macrofile, is given but the third argument is not,the macro file will be executed for all of theevent.If the third argument (nSelect) is given, themacro file will be executed only for the firstnSelect events.

breakAtBeginOfEvent.guidance: Set a break point at the begining of every event.

breakAtEndOfEvent.guidance: Set a break point at the end of every event.

constructScoringWorlds.guidance: Constrct scoring parallel world(s) if defined.This command is not mandatory, but automatically called when a run starts.But the user may use this to visualize the scoring world(s) before a run to start.

dumpCouples.guidance: Dump material-cuts-couple information.Note that material-cuts-couple information is updatedafter BeamOn has started.

dumpRegion.guidance: Dump region information.In case name of a region is not given, all regions will be displayed.

eventModulo.guidance: Set the event modulo for dispatching events to worker threadsi.e. each worker thread is ordered to simulate N events and thencomes back to G4MTRunManager for next set.If it is set to zero (default value), N is roughly given by this.N = int( sqrt( number_of_events / number_of_threads ) )The value N may affect on the computing performance in particularif N is too small compared to the total number of events.The second parameter seedOnce specifies how frequently each workerthread is seeded by the random number sequence contrally managedby the master G4MTRunManager.- If seedOnce is set to 0 (default), seeds that are centrally managedby G4MTRunManager are set for every event of every worker thread.This option guarantees event reproducability regardless of numberof threads.- If seedOnce is set to 1, seeds are set only once for the firstevent of each run of each worker thread. Event reproducability isguaranteed only if the same number of worker threads are used.On the other hand, this option offers better computing performancein particular for applications with relatively small primaryparticle energy and large number of events.- If seedOnce is set to 2, seeds are set only for the first event ofgroup of N events. This option is reserved for the future use whenGeant4 allows number of threads to be dynatically changed during anevent loop.This command is valid only for multi-threaded mode.This command is ignored if it is issued in sequential mode.

geometryModified.guidance: Force geometry to be closed (re-voxellized) again.This command must be applied if geometry has been modifiedafter the first initialization (or BeamOn).

getCutForAGivenParticle.guidance: Get a cut value to a specific particleUsage: /run/getCutForAGivenParticle  gamma

numberOfThreads.guidance: Set the number of threads to be used.This command works only in PreInit state.This command is valid only for multi-threaded mode.The command is ignored if it is issued in sequential mode.Range of parameters : nThreads >0

optimizeGeometry.guidance: Set the optimization flag for geometry.If it is set to TRUE, G4GeometryManager will optimizethe geometry definitions.GEANT4 is initialized with this flag as TRUE.

addProcManager.guidance: add process manager to specified particle type

applyCuts.guidance: Set applyCuts flag for a particle.Some EM processes which do not have infrared divergencemay generate gamma, e- and/or e+ with kinetic energiesbelow the production threshold. By setting this flag,such secondaries below threshold are eliminated andkinetic energies of such secondaries are accumulatedto the energy deposition of their mother.Note that 'applyCuts' makes sense only for gamma,e- and e+. If this command is issued for other particle,a warning message is displayed and the command isignored.If particle name is 'all', this command affects ongamma, e- and e+.

buildPhysicsTable.guidance: build physics table of specified particle type

dumpCutValues.guidance: Dump a list of production threshold values in range and energyfor all registered material-cuts-couples.Dumping a list takes place when you issue 'beamOn' andactual conversion tables from range to energy are available.If you want a list 'immediately', use '/run/dumpRegion' for thresholdlist given in gange only. Also, '/run/dumpCouples' gives you thecurrent list if you have already issued 'run/beamOn' at least once.

dumpList.guidance: Dump List of particles in G4VUserPhysicsList.

dumpOrderingParam.guidance: Dump a list of ordering parameterRandom number status control commands.Sub-directories :Commands :setSeeds * Initialize the random number generator with integer seed stream.setDirectoryName * Define the directory name of the rndm status files.setSavingFlag * The randomNumberStatus will be saved at :saveThisRun * copy currentRun.rndm to runXXX.rndmsaveThisEvent * copy currentEvent.rndm to runXXXevtYYY.rndmresetEngineFrom * Reset the status of the rndm engine from a file.resetEngineFromEachEvent * Reset the status of the rndm engine from a file at each event.saveEachEventFlag * Save random number status at beginning of each event.

retrievePhysicsTable.guidance: Retrieve Physics TableEnter directory name or OFF to switch off

setStoredInAscii.guidance: Switch on/off ascii mode in store/retreive Physics TableEnter 0(binary) or 1(ascii)Range of parameters : ascii ==0 || ascii ==1

verbose.guidance: Set the Verbose level of G4VUserPhysicsList.0 : Silent (default)1 : Display warning messages2 : Display moreRange of parameters : level >=0 && level <=3

physicsModified.guidance: Force all physics tables recalculated again.This command must be appliedif physics process has been modified after thefirst initialization (or BeamOn).

pinAffinity.guidance: Locks each thread to a specific logical core. Workers are locked in round robin to logical cores.This command is valid only for multi-threaded mode.This command works only in PreInit state.This command is ignored if it is issued in sequential mode.If a value n>0 is provided it starts setting affinity from the n-th CPU (note: counting from 1).E.g. /run/pinAffinity 3 locks first thread on third logical CPU (number 2).If a value n<0 is provided never locks on n-th CPU.Range of parameters : pinAffinity > 0 || pinAffinity < 0

printProgress.guidance: Display begin_of_event information at given frequency.If it is set to zero, only the begin_of_run is shown.If it is set to -1, no print-out is shown.Range of parameters : mod>=-1

reinitializeGeometry.guidance: Force geometry to be rebuilt once again.This command must be applied if the user needs his/herdetector construction to be reinvoked./run/geometryModified is automatically issued with this command.

setCut.guidance: Set default cut valueRange of parameters : cut >=0.0

setCutForAGivenParticle.guidance: Set a cut value to a specific particleUsage: /run/setCutForAGivenParticle  gamma  1. mm

setCutForRegion.guidance: Set cut value for a regionCommands for G4VUserPhysicsList.Sub-directories :Commands :verbose * Set the Verbose level of G4VUserPhysicsList.dumpList * Dump List of particles in G4VUserPhysicsList.addProcManager * add process manager to specified particle typebuildPhysicsTable * build physics table of specified particle typestorePhysicsTable * Store Physics TableretrievePhysicsTable * Retrieve Physics TablesetStoredInAscii * Switch on/off ascii mode in store/retreive Physics TableapplyCuts * Set applyCuts flag for a particle.dumpCutValues * Dump a list of production threshold values in range and energydumpOrderingParam * Dump a list of ordering parameter

storeRndmStatToEvent.guidance: Flag to store rndm status to G4Event object.flag = 0 : not store (default)flag = 1 : status before primary particle generation is storedflag = 2 : status before event processing (after primary particle generation) is storedflag = 3 : both are storedNote: Some performance overhead may be seen by storing rndm status, in particularfor the case of simplest geometry and small number of tracks per event.Range of parameters : flag>=0 && flag<3

useMaximumLogicalCores.guidance: Set the number of threads to be the number of available logical cores.This command works only in PreInit state.This command is valid only for multi-threaded mode.The command is ignored if it is issued in sequential mode.

verbose.guidance: Set the Verbose level of G4RunManager.0 : Silent (default)1 : Display main topics2 : Display main topics and run summaryRange of parameters : level >=0 && level <=2

storeTrajectory.guidance: Store trajectories or not.0 : Don't Store trajectories.!=0 : Store trajectories.1 : Choose G4Trajectory as default.2 : Choose G4SmoothTrajectory as default.3 : Choose G4RichTrajectory as default.4 : Choose G4RichTrajectory with auxiliary points as default.Range of parameters : Store >=0 && Store <= 4

verbose.guidance: Set Verbose level of tracking category.-1 : Silent.0 : Silent.1 : Minium information of each Step.2 : Addition to Level=1, info of secondary particles.3 : Addition to Level=1, pre/postStepoint informationafter all AlongStep/PostStep process executions.4 : Addition to Level=3, pre/postStepoint informationat each AlongStepPostStep process execuation.5 : Addition to Level=4, proposed Step length informationfrom each AlongStepPostStep process.Range of parameters : verbose_level >=-1Particle control commands.Sub-directories :/particle/manage/   ...Title not available.../particle/property/   Paricle Table control commands./particle/process/   Process Manager control commands.Commands :select * Select particlelist * List name of particles.find * Find particle by encodingcreateAllIon * Create All ions (ground state)createAllIsomer * Create All isomersverbose * Set Verbose level of particle table.

list.guidance: full list of available units.Command directory path : /process/Process Table control commands.Sub-directories :/process/had/   ...Title not available.../process/eLoss/   Commands for EM processes./process/msc/   Commands for EM scattering processes./process/em/   General commands for EM processes.Commands :list * List up process namesverbose * Set Verbose Level for Process TablesetVerbose * Set verbose level for processesdump * Dump process informationactivate * Activate processesinactivate * Inactivate process

outFile.guidance: Set name of output file.HepRep commands.Sub-directories :Commands :setFileDir * Set directory for output.setFileName * Set file name for output.setOverwrite * Set true to write all output to exact same file name.setCullInvisibles * Remove invisible objects from output file.renderCylAsPolygons * Render cylinders and cones as polygons.scale * Re-Scale coordinates.center * Re-Center coordinates.setEventNumberSuffix * Write separate event files, appended with given suffix.appendGeometry * Appends copy of geometry to every event.addPointAttributes * Adds point attributes to the points of trajectories.useSolids * Use HepRep Solids, rather than Geant4 Primitives.

drawTree.guidance: (DTREE) Creates a scene consisting of this physical volume and  produces a representation of the geometry hieracrhy.The scene becomes current.

drawView.guidance: Draw view from this angle, etc.

drawVolume.guidance: Creates a scene containing this physical volume and asks thecurrent viewer to draw it.  The scene becomes current.If physical-volume-name is "world" (the default), the main geometrytree (material world) is drawn.  If "worlds", all worlds - materialworld and parallel worlds, if any - are drawn.  Otherwise a search ofall worlds is made, taking the first matching occurence only.  To seea representation of the geometry hierarchy of the worlds, try"/vis/drawTree [worlds]" or one of the driver/browser combinationsthat have the required functionality, e.g., HepRep

attributeFilter.guidance: Create a attributeFilter model and associated messengers.Generated model becomes current.Operations on vis attributes of Geant4 geometry.Sub-directories :/vis/geometry/set/   Set vis attributes of Geant4 geometry.Commands :list * Lists vis attributes of logical volume(s).restore * Restores vis attributes of logical volume(s).

Create a attributeFilter model and associated messengers.Generated model becomes current.Digi filtering commands.Sub-directories :/vis/filtering/digi/create/   Create digi filters and messengers.Commands :list * List objects registered with list managermode * Set mode of operation

Create a attributeFilter model and associated messengers.Generated model becomes current.Hit filtering commands.Sub-directories :/vis/filtering/hits/create/   Create hit filters and messengers.Commands :list * List objects registered with list managermode * Set mode of operation

chargeFilter.guidance: Create a chargeFilter model and associated messengers.Generated model becomes current.

originVolumeFilter.guidance: Create a originVolumeFilter model and associated messengers.Generated model becomes current.

particleFilter.guidance: Create a particleFilter model and associated messengers.Generated model becomes current.

addHitName.guidance: hit name for a dose distribution in gMocren data.

addHitScorerName.guidance: hit scorer name for a dose distribution in gMocren data.

addPointAttributes.guidance: Adds point attributes to the points of trajectories.

appendGeometry.guidance: Appends copy of geometry to every event.

drawVolumeGrid.guidance: Add grid of the volume.G4OpenGLViewer commands.Sub-directories :/vis/ogl/set/   G4OpenGLViewer set commands.Commands :printEPS * Print Encapsulated PostScript file.export * export a screenshot of current OpenGL viewer

setEventNumberSuffix.guidance: Write separate event files, appended with given suffix.Define the suffix with a pattern such as '-0000'.

setScoringMeshName.guidance: scoring mesh name for a dose distribution in gMocren data.

setVolumeName.guidance: detector name for a volume data in gMocren data.

useSolids.guidance: Use GMocren Solids, rather than Geant4 Primitives.

colour.guidance: Sets colour of logical volume(s)."all" sets all logical volumes.Optionally propagates down hierarchy to given depth.

daughtersInvisible.guidance: Makes daughters of logical volume(s) invisible."all" sets all logical volumes.Optionally propagates down hierarchy to given depth.

forceAuxEdgeVisible.guidance: Forces auxiliary (soft) edges of logical volume(s) to be visible,regardless of the view parameters."all" sets all logical volumes.Optionally propagates down hierarchy to given depth.

forceLineSegmentsPerCircle.guidance: Forces number of line segments per circle, the precision with which acurved line or surface is represented by a polygon or polyhedron,regardless of the view parameters."all" sets all logical volumes.Optionally propagates down hierarchy to given depth.

forceSolid.guidance: Forces logical volume(s) always to be drawn solid (surface drawing),regardless of the view parameters."all" sets all logical volumes.Optionally propagates down hierarchy to given depth.

forceWireframe.guidance: Forces logical volume(s) always to be drawn as wireframe,regardless of the view parameters."all" sets all logical volumes.Optionally propagates down hierarchy to given depth.

lineStyle.guidance: Sets line style of logical volume(s) drawing."all" sets all logical volumes.Optionally propagates down hierarchy to given depth.

lineWidth.guidance: Sets line width of logical volume(s) drawing."all" sets all logical volumes.Optionally propagates down hierarchy to given depth.

visibility.guidance: Sets visibility of logical volume(s)."all" sets all logical volumes.Optionally propagates down hierarchy to given depth.Commands unique to multithreading mode.Sub-directories :Commands :actionOnEventQueueFull * When event queue for drawing gets full:maxEventQueueSize * Defines maximum event queue size. N <=0 means "unlimited".

addPointAttributes.guidance: Adds point attributes to the points of trajectories.This command is used by HepRepXML, not by HepRepFile.

appendGeometry.guidance: Appends copy of geometry to every event.This command is used by HepRepXML, not by HepRepFile.

renderCylAsPolygons.guidance: Render cylinders and cones as polygons.This command is used by HepRepFile, not by HepRepXML.

setCullInvisibles.guidance: Remove invisible objects from output file.This command is used by HepRepFile, not by HepRepXML.

setEventNumberSuffix.guidance: Write separate event files, appended with given suffix.Define the suffix with a pattern such as '-0000'.This command is used by HepRepXML, not by HepRepFile.

setFileDir.guidance: Set directory for output.This command is used by HepRepFile, not by HepRepXML.

setFileName.guidance: Set file name for output.This command is used by HepRepFile, not by HepRepXML.

setOverwrite.guidance: Set true to write all output to exact same file name.Set false to increment the file name for each new output.This command is used by HepRepFile, not by HepRepXML.

useSolids.guidance: Use HepRep Solids, rather than Geant4 Primitives.This command is used by HepRepXML, not by HepRepFile..RayTracer commands.Sub-directories :Commands :trace * Start the ray tracing.column * Define the number of horizontal pixels.row * Define the number of virtical pixels.target * Define the center position of the target.eyePosition * Define the eye position.lightDirection * Define the direction of illumination light.span * Define the angle per 100 pixels.headAngle * Define the head direction.attenuation * Define the attenuation length for transparent material.distortion * Distortion effect of the fish eye lens.ignoreTransparency * Ignore transparency even if the alpha of G4Colour < 1.backgroundColour * Command has been deprecated.  Use /vis/viewer/set/background instead.

actionOnEventQueueFull.guidance: When event queue for drawing gets full:wait: event processing waits for vis manager to catch up.discard: events are discarded for drawing.

maxEventQueueSize.guidance: Defines maximum event queue size. N <=0 means "unlimited".If adding an event to the visualisation event queue would cause the queue size to exceed this value:if actionOnEventQueueFull==wait the worker threads are paused for a short time to give the visualisation manager a chance to catch up.if actionOnEventQueueFull==discard the event is discarded for drawing.Set quantities for use in future commands where appropriate.Sub-directories :Commands :colour * Defines colour and opacity for future "/vis/scene/add/" commands.lineWidth * Defines line width for future "/vis/scene/add/" commands.textColour * Defines colour and opacity for future "/vis/scene/add/text" commands.textLayout * Defines layout future "/vis/scene/add/text" commands.textSize * Defines text size (pixels) for future "/vis/scene/add/" commands.touchable * Defines touchable for future "/vis/touchable/set/" commands.

displayHeadTime.guidance: Display head time of range in 2D text.

displayLightFront.guidance: Display the light front at head time.Tip: The trajectories can appear of jump ahead of the light frontbecause their time range overlaps the viewer's time range.  Toaverage out this discrete time effect, advance the light front byhalf the trajectories interval. E.g., if the trajectory time sliceinterval is 0.01 ns:  /vis/ogl/set/displayLightFront true -90 0 0 mm -0.005 nsTo prevent them beating the light front at all:  /vis/ogl/set/displayLightFront true -90 0 0 mm -0.01 ns

displayListLimit.guidance: Set/reset display list limit (to avoid memory exhaustion).Range of parameters : limit>=10000

endTime.guidance: Set end and range of track time.

eventsDrawInterval.guidance: Set number of events allowed in drawing pipeline - speeds drawingBy default, the screen is updated at the end of every event.Allowing OpenGL to buffer several events can make a big improvementin drawing speed.

exportFormat.guidance: Set export formatBy default, pdf/eps/svg/ps are available. Depending of viewers several other format are available.Try /vis/ogl/set/exportFormat without parameters to see them.Changing format will reset the incremental suffix to 0.

fade.guidance: 0: no fade; 1: maximum fade with time within range.Range of parameters : fadefactor>=0.&&fadefactor<=1.

printFilename.guidance: Set print filenameSetting 'incremental' will increment filename by one at each new print, starting at 0

printMode.guidance: Set print mode, only available for "ps" format

printSize.guidance: Set print sizeTip : -1 will mean 'print size' = 'window size'Setting size greatter than your maximum graphic card capacity , will set the size to maximum  size.

startTime.guidance: Set start and range of track time.

transparency.guidance: True/false to enable/disable rendering of transparent objects.Modeling commands.Sub-directories :/vis/modeling/trajectories/   Trajectory model commands.Commands :Command directory path : /vis/modeling/trajectories/Trajectory model commands.Sub-directories :/vis/modeling/trajectories/create/   Create trajectory models and messengers./vis/modeling/trajectories/drawByCharge-0/   Commands for drawByCharge-0 model.Commands :list * List objects registered with list managerselect * Select created object

open.guidance: Creates a scene handler ready for drawing.The scene handler becomes current (the name is auto-generated).

attenuation.guidance: Define the attenuation length for transparent material.Note that this value is independent to the attenuation length for the optical photon processes.Range of parameters : Length > 0.

backgroundColour.guidance: Command has been deprecated.  Use /vis/viewer/set/background instead.gMocren commands.Sub-directories :Commands :setEventNumberSuffix * Write separate event files, appended with given suffix.appendGeometry * Appends copy of geometry to every event.addPointAttributes * Adds point attributes to the points of trajectories.useSolids * Use GMocren Solids, rather than Geant4 Primitives.setVolumeName * detector name for a volume data in gMocren data.addHitName * hit name for a dose distribution in gMocren data.resetHitNames * reset all hit names.setScoringMeshName * scoring mesh name for a dose distribution in gMocren data.addHitScorerName * hit scorer name for a dose distribution in gMocren data.resetHitScorerName * reset all hit scorer names.setNumberOfVoxels * set number of voxels.list * list gMocren command parameters.drawVolumeGrid * Add grid of the volume.

column.guidance: Define the number of horizontal pixels.Range of parameters : nPixel > 0

distortion.guidance: Distortion effect of the fish eye lens.

eyePosition.guidance: Define the eye position.Eye direction is calsurated from (target - eyePosition).

headAngle.guidance: Define the head direction.Range of parameters : headAngle>=0. && headAngle<360.

ignoreTransparency.guidance: Ignore transparency even if the alpha of G4Colour < 1.

lightDirection.guidance: Define the direction of illumination light.The vector needs not to be a unit vector, but it must not be a zero vector.Range of parameters : Px != 0 || Py != 0 || Pz != 0

row.guidance: Define the number of virtical pixels.Range of parameters : nPixel > 0

span.guidance: Define the angle per 100 pixels.Range of parameters : span>0.

target.guidance: Define the center position of the target.

trace.guidance: Start the ray tracing.Define the name of output JPEG file.

reviewKeptEvents.guidance: Review kept events.If a macro file is specified, it is executed for each event.If a macro file is not specified, each event is drawn to the currentviewer.  After each event, the session is paused.  The user may issueany allowed command.  Then enter "cont[inue]" to continue to the nextevent.Useful commands might be:  "/vis/viewer/..." to change the view (zoom, set/viewpoint,...).  "/vis/oglx/printEPS" to get hard copy.  "/vis/open" to get alternative viewer.  "/vis/abortReviewKeptEvents", then "cont[inue]", to abort.

axes.guidance: Add axes.Draws axes at (x0, y0, z0) of given length and colour.If "unitcolour" is "auto", x, y and z will be red, green and blue  respectively.  Otherwise choose from the pre-defined text-specified  colours - see information printed by the vis manager at start-up or  use "/vis/list".If "length" is negative, it is set to about 25% of scene extent.If "showtext" is false, annotations are suppressed.

date.guidance: Adds date to current scene.If "date"is omitted, the current date and time is drawn.Otherwise, the string, including the rest of the line, is drawn.

digis.guidance: Adds digis to current scene.Digis are drawn at end of event when the scene in whichthey are added is current.

eventID.guidance: Adds eventID to current scene.Run and event numbers are drawn at end of event or run when the scene in which they are added is current.

extent.guidance: Adds a dummy model with given extent to the current scene.Requires the limits: xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax, zmin, zmax unit.This can be used to provide an extent to the scene even ifno other models with extent are available. For example,even if there is no geometry.  In that case, for example:  /vis/open OGL  /vis/scene/create  /vis/scene/add/extent -300 300 -300 300 -300 300 cm  /vis/sceneHandler/attach

hits.guidance: Adds hits to current scene.Hits are drawn at end of event when the scene in whichthey are added is current.

logicalVolume.guidance: Adds a logical volume to the current scene,Shows boolean components (if any), voxels (if any) and readout geometry(if any).  Note: voxels are not constructed until start of run - "/run/beamOn".  (For voxels without a run, "/run/beamOn 0".)

logo.guidance: Adds a G4 logo to the current scene.If "unit" is "auto", height is roughly one tenth of scene extent."direction" is that of outward-facing normal to front face of logo.If "direction" is "auto", logo faces the user in the current viewer.If "placement" is "auto", logo is placed at bottom right of screen  when viewed from logo direction.

magneticField.guidance: Adds magnetic field representation to current scene.The first parameter is no. of data points per half scene.  So, possibly, atmaximum, the number of data points sampled is (2*n+1)^3, which can growlarge--be warned!You might find that your scene is cluttered by thousands of arrows forthe default number of data points, so try reducing to 2 or 3, e.g:  /vis/scene/add/magneticField 3or, if only a small part of the scene has a field:  /vis/scene/add/magneticField 50 # or moreIn the arrow representation, the length of the arrow is proportionalto the magnitude of the field and the colour is mapped onto the rangeas a fraction of the maximum magnitude: 0->0.5->1 is blue->green->red.

psHits.guidance: Adds Primitive Scorer Hits (PSHits) to current scene.PSHits are drawn at end of run when the scene in whichthey are added is current.Optional parameter specifies name of scoring map.  By default allscoring maps registered with the G4ScoringManager are drawn.

scale.guidance: Adds an annotated scale line to the current scene.If "unit" is "auto", length is roughly one tenth of the scene extent.If "direction" is "auto", scale is roughly in the plane of the current view.If "placement" is "auto", scale is placed at bottom left of current view.  Otherwise placed at (xmid,ymid,zmid).An annotated line in the specified direction with tick marks at theend.  If autoPlacing is true it is required to be centred at thefront, right, bottom corner of the world space, comfortably outsidethe existing bounding box/sphere so that existing objects do notobscure it.  Otherwise it is required to be drawn with mid-point at(xmid, ymid, zmid).The auto placing algorithm might be:  x = xmin + (1 + comfort) * (xmax - xmin);  y = ymin - comfort * (ymax - ymin);  z = zmin + (1 + comfort) * (zmax - zmin);  if direction == x then (x - length,y,z) to (x,y,z);  if direction == y then (x,y,z) to (x,y + length,z);  if direction == z then (x,y,z - length) to (x,y,z);

text.guidance: Adds text to current scene.Use "/vis/set/textColour" to set colour.Use "/vis/set/textLayout" to set layout:

text2D.guidance: Adds 2D text to current scene.Use "/vis/set/textColour" to set colour.Use "/vis/set/textLayout" to set layout:

trajectories.guidance: Adds trajectories to current scene.Causes trajectories, if any, to be drawn at the end of processing anevent.  Switches on trajectory storing and sets thedefault trajectory type.The command line parameter list determines the default trajectory type.If it contains the string "smooth", auxiliary inter-step points willbe inserted to improve the smoothness of the drawing of a curvedtrajectory.If it contains the string "rich", significant extra information willbe stored in the trajectory (G4RichTrajectory) amenable to modelingand filtering with "/vis/modeling/trajectories/create/drawByAttribute"and "/vis/filtering/trajectories/create/attributeFilter" commands.It may contain both strings in any order.To switch off trajectory storing: "/tracking/storeTrajectory 0".See also "/vis/scene/endOfEventAction".Note:  This only sets the default.  Independently of the result of thiscommand, a user may instantiate a trajectory that overrides this defaultin PreUserTrackingAction.

userAction.guidance: Add named Vis User Action to current scene.Attempts to match search string to name of action - use unique sub-string.(Use /vis/list to see names of registered actions.)If name == "all" (default), all actions are added.

volume.guidance: Adds a physical volume to current scene, with optional clipping volume.If physical-volume-name is "world" (the default), the top of themain geometry tree (material world) is added.  If "worlds", thetop of all worlds - material world and parallel worlds, if any - areadded.  Otherwise a search of all worlds is made, taking the firstmatching occurence only.  To see a representation of the geometryhierarchy of the worlds, try "/vis/drawTree [worlds]" or one of thedriver/browser combinations that have the required functionality, e.g., HepRep.If clip-volume-type is specified, the subsequent parameters are used toto define a clipping volume.  For example,"/vis/scene/add/volume ! ! ! -box km 0 1 0 1 0 1" will draw the worldwith the positive octant cut away.  (If the Boolean Processor issueswarnings try replacing 0 by 0.000000001 or something.)If clip-volume-type is prepended with '-', the clip-volume is subtracted(cutaway). (This is the default if there is no prepended character.)If '*' is prepended, the intersection of the physical-volume and theclip-volume is made. (You can make a section/DCUT with a thin box, forexample).For "box", the parameters are xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,zmin,zmax.Only "box" is programmed at present.Operations on Geant4 scene handlers.Sub-directories :Commands :attach * Attaches scene to current scene handler.create * Creates an scene handler for a specific graphics system.list * Lists scene handler(s).select * Selects a scene handler.

attach.guidance: Attaches scene to current scene handler.If scene-name is omitted, current scene is attached.  To see scenes andscene handlers, use "/vis/scene/list" and "/vis/sceneHandler/list"

create.guidance: Creates an scene handler for a specific graphics system.Attaches current scene, if any.  (You can change attached scenes with"/vis/sceneHandler/attach".)  Invents a scene handler name if notsupplied.  This scene handler becomes current.

list.guidance: Lists scene handler(s)."help /vis/verbose" for definition of verbosity.

select.guidance: Selects a scene handler.Makes the scene handler current.  "/vis/sceneHandler/list" to see possible scene handler names.Operations on touchables.Sub-directories :/vis/touchable/set/   Set vis attributes of current touchable.Commands :dump * Dump touchable attributes.

colour.guidance: Defines colour and opacity for future "/vis/scene/add/" commands.(Except "/vis/scene/add/text" commands - see "/vis/set/textColour".)Default: white and opaque.

lineWidth.guidance: Defines line width for future "/vis/scene/add/" commands.Range of parameters : lineWidth >= 1.

textColour.guidance: Defines colour and opacity for future "/vis/scene/add/text" commands.Default: blue and opaque.

textLayout.guidance: Defines layout future "/vis/scene/add/text" commands."left" (default) for left justification to provided coordinate."centre" or "center" for text centered on provided coordinate."right" for right justification to provided coordinate.Default: left.

textSize.guidance: Defines text size (pixels) for future "/vis/scene/add/" commands.Range of parameters : textSize >= 1.

touchable.guidance: Defines touchable for future "/vis/touchable/set/" commands.Please provide a list of space-separated physical volume names andcopy number pairs starting at the world volume, e.g:  /vis/set/touchable World 0 Envelope 0 Shape1 0(To get list of touchables, use "/vis/drawTree")(To save, use "/vis/viewer/save")Operations on Geant4 scenes.Sub-directories :/vis/scene/add/   Add model to current scene.Commands :activateModel * Activate or de-activate model.create * Creates an empty scene.endOfEventAction * Accumulate or refresh the viewer for each new event.endOfRunAction * Accumulate or refresh the viewer for each new run.list * Lists scene(s).notifyHandlers * Notifies scene handlers and forces re-rendering.select * Selects a scene

specify.guidance: Draws logical volume with Boolean components, voxels and readout geometry.Creates a scene consisting of this logical volume and asks the  current viewer to draw it to the specified depth of descent  showing boolean components (if any), voxels (if any)  and readout geometry (if any), under control of the appropriate flag.Note: voxels are not constructed until start of run - /run/beamOn.The scene becomes current.Commands for ASCIITree control.Sub-directories :/vis/ASCIITree/set/   Settings for ASCIITree control.Commands :verbose *   <  10: - does not print daughters of repeated placements, does not repeat replicas.

colour.guidance: Set colour of current touchable.Use "/vis/set/touchable" to set current touchable.If "red" is a string understood by the vis system it will be taken.  Otherwise the values ofed", "green", etc., are used.

daughtersInvisible.guidance: Daughters of current touchable invisible: true/false.Use "/vis/set/touchable" to set current touchable.

forceAuxEdgeVisible.guidance: Force auxiliary (soft) edges of current touchable to be visible: true/false.Use "/vis/set/touchable" to set current touchable.

forceSolid.guidance: Force current touchable always to be drawn solid (surface drawing).Use "/vis/set/touchable" to set current touchable.

forceWireframe.guidance: Force current touchable always to be drawn as wireframe.Use "/vis/set/touchable" to set current touchable.

lineSegmentsPerCircle.guidance: For current touchable, set number of line segments per circle, theprecision with which a curved line or surface is represented by apolygon or polyhedron, regardless of the view parameters.Negative to pick up G4Polyhedron default value.Use "/vis/set/touchable" to set current touchable.

lineStyle.guidance: Set line style of current touchable drawing.Use "/vis/set/touchable" to set current touchable.

lineWidth.guidance: Set line width of current touchable.Use "/vis/set/touchable" to set current touchable.

visibility.guidance: Set visibility of current touchable: true/false.Use "/vis/set/touchable" to set current touchable.Operations on Geant4 viewers.Sub-directories :/vis/viewer/default/   Set default values for future viewers./vis/viewer/set/   Set view parameters of current viewer.Commands :addCutawayPlane * Add cutaway plane to current viewer.changeCutawayPlane * Change cutaway plane.clear * Clears viewer.clearCutawayPlanes * Clear cutaway planes of current viewer.clearTransients * Clears transients from viewer.clone * Clones viewer.copyViewFrom * Copy the camera-specific parameters from the specified viewer.create * Creates a viewer for the specified scene handler.dolly * Incremental dolly.dollyTo * Dolly to specific coordinate.flush * Compound command: "/vis/viewer/refresh" + "/vis/viewer/update".list * Lists viewers(s).pan * Incremental pan.panTo * Pan to specific coordinate.rebuild * Forces rebuild of graphical database.refresh * Refreshes viewer.reset * Resets viewer.save * Write commands that define the current view to file.scale * Incremental (non-uniform) scaling.scaleTo * Absolute (non-uniform) scaling.select * Selects viewer.update * Triggers graphical database post-processing for viewersusing that technique.zoom * Incremental zoom.zoomTo * Absolute zoom.

verbose.guidance: Simple graded message scheme - digit or string (1st character defines):0) quiet,          Nothing is printed.1) startup,        Startup and endup messages are printed...2) errors,         ...and errors...3) warnings,       ...and warnings...4) confirmations,  ...and confirming messages...5) parameters,     ...and parameters of scenes and views...6) all             ...and everything available.
